info.name: Worksection Client API
info.description:
Worksection API allows you to access our service and get/send data for simultaneous interaction of the service with other programs

---

To get access to Worksection API you can use:

- admin token
- oauth2 access token
    

---

To use **admin token**:

1. get Worksection API key (see [details](https://worksection.com/en/faq/api-start.html#q1638))
2. save it into Postman '_api'_ collection variable  
    path: `'Worksection Client API' collection folder -> 'Variables' tab ->` **`'Current value' column`**
3. save your Worksection account URL into Postman '_account_url_' collection variable  
    example: `https://youraccount.worksection.com`
4. enable Postman '_admin_token_' collection variable
5. save collection
6. you are ready to go
    

---

To use **oauth2 access token**:  
_\*if you don't have this token_

1. create Worksection API app (see [details](https://worksection.com/en/faq/oauth.html#q1812))
2. save its '_Client ID_', '_Client Secret_' and '_Redirect URL_' into Postman '_client_id_', '_client_secret_' and '_redirect_url_' collection variables  
    path: `'Worksection Client API' collection folder -> 'Variables' tab ->` **`'Current value' column`**
3. save your Worksection account URL into Postman '_account_url_' collection variable  
    example: `https://youraccount.worksection.com`
4. disable Postman '_admin_token_' collection variable
5. save collection
6. create access token  
    path: `'Worksection Client API' collection folder -> 'Authorization' tab -> 'Get New Access Token' button`
7. apply this token with '_Use Token_' button
8. you are ready to go
    

---

To use **oauth2 access token**:  
_\*if you already have this token_

1. save your Worksection account URL into Postman '_account_url_' collection variable  
    example: `https://youraccount.worksection.com`
2. save collection
3. save your token into Postman '_Token_' input  
    path: `'Worksection Client API' collection folder -> 'Authorization' tab ->` **`'Current value' column`**
    
4. you are ready to go

request.description: ###### Returns account contact folders list

###### Creates account contacts folder

_\*if there are no folders with same name_

###### Subscribes user to selected task

_\*task subscribers list can be obtained through 'get_task' method with 'extra=subscribers' parameter_

###### Unsubscribes user from selected task

_\*task subscribers list can be obtained through 'get_task' method with 'extra=subscribers' parameter_

item.description:
###### Methods to

- create teams for members and folders for contacts
- invite new account members
- create contacts
- get a list of teams, members and contacts
- add and exclude project members
- subscribe and unsubscribe task members
    

[API members docs](https://worksection.com/en/faq/api-user.html)

item.name: Projects

query.description:
(Optional) Project state, possible values: **active|pending|archive**

_active_ - active projects
_pending_ - sleeping projects (muted, so don't send notifications)
_archive_ - archived projects

(Optional) Additional project info, possible values (can be specified with commas): **text|options|users**

_text_ or _html_ - description in text or html format
_options_ - project restriction options
_users_ - project team members

request.description: ###### Returns all projects info

response.name: success

query.description:
(Optional) Project status, possible values: **active|pending|archive**

_active_ - active projects (default status)
_pending_ - sleeping projects (muted, so don't send notifications)
_archive_ - archived projects

(Optional) Additional project info, possible values (can be specified with commas): **text|options|users**

_text_ or _html_ - description in text or html format
_options_ - project restriction options
_users_ - project team members

request.description: ###### Returns selected project info

response.name: success

query.description:
(Optional) Additional project info, possible values (can be specified with commas): **text|options|users**

_text_ or _html_ - description in text or html format
_options_ - project restriction options
_users_ - project team members

(Optional) Additional project info, possible values (can be specified with commas): **text|options|users**

_text_ or _html_ - description in text or html format
_options_ - project restriction options
_users_ - project team members

(Optional) User email of a default task executive, possible values: **ANY|NOONE**

_ANY_ - for "Anyone"
_NOONE_ - for "Executive isn't assigned"
(Optional) Project member emails separated by commas
(Optional) Folder name, where the project will be located
(Optional) Due date or end date in DD.MM.YYYY format

(Optional) Project tags separated by commas

You can specify names (if they are unique) or their IDs (can be obtained through _get_project_tags_ method)
(Optional) Project restriction options info, possible value: **options**

(Optional) Project restriction option  Assignee can mark task as done, possible values: **1|0**

_1_ - enable
_0_ - disable
(Optional) Project restriction option  Assignee can transfer the responsibility, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Assignee can change the task terms, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Assignee can change the estimates, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  New task requires terms, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  New task requires stages and labels, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  New task requires estimates, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  New task requires visibility, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Users are not permitted to edit and delete comments, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Users are not permitted to edit and delete tasks, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Users are not permitted to delete tasks, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Mark as done with costs only, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Adding costs for today only, possible values: **1|0**
(Optional) Project restriction option  Adding costs from timer only, possible values: **1|0**

query.description:
(Required) Time period, possible values: **1m..360m|1h..72h|1d..30d**

_1m..360m_ - in minutes
_1h..72h_ - in hours
_1d..30d_ - in days

item.description:
###### Methods to

- create, edit, archive and activate projects
- create project folders
- get particular project info
- get a list of projects and folders
- create, set and unset project tags
    

[API projects docs](https://worksection.com/en/faq/api-projects.html)

item.name: Tasks

query.description:
(Optional) Incomplete tasks, possible value: **active**

ompleted tasks filtering is not available

(Optional) Additional task info, possible values (can be specified with commas): **text|files|comments|relations|subtasks|archive**

_text_ or _html_ - description in text or html format
_files_ - attached files info (in task description)
_comments_ - five last comments
_relations_ - dependencies with other tasks
_subtasks_ - list of subtasks (in 'child' dataset)
_archive_ - tasks of archived projects

request.description: ###### Completes selected (sub)task
###### Reopens selected completed (sub)task

query.description:
(Conditional) Project ID

At least one of parameters required: _id_project, id_task, email_user_from, email_user_to, filter_

(Conditional) Search query (see description below)

Integer fields:

id=TASK_ID - returns particular task
project=PROJECT_ID - returns tasks of a particular project
parent=TASK_ID - returns subtasks of a particular parent task

Equality and range operators for integer fields: =, in
Example: `project = 2456`, `id in (1234, 1240)`


String fields:

name - task name

Full or partial match for string fields: =, has
Example: `name = 'Task Report'`, `name has 'Report'`


Date fields:

dateadd - task creation date in 'DD.MM.YYYY' format
datestart - task start date in 'DD.MM.YYYY' format
dateend - task due date or end date in 'DD.MM.YYYY' format
dateclose - task closing date in 'DD.MM.YYYY' format

Relational operators for date fields: >, <, >=, <=, ! =, =
Example: `dateadd = '01.05.2021'`


Query conditions can be combined with parentheses () and logical operations and, or (only in lowercase)
Example filter query: `&filter=(name has 'Report' or name has 'Approval') and (dateend>'25.05.2021' and dateend<'31.05.2021')`

(Optional) Task state, possible values: **active|done**

_active_ - incomplete tasks
_done_ - completed tasks

(Optional) Additional task info, possible values (can be specified with commas): **text|files**

_text_ or _html_ - description in text or html format
_files_ - attached files info (in task description)

request.description: ###### Returns tasks that meet search query

response.name: success

item.name: Costs

query.description: (Optional) Project ID (costs of all tasks of a particular project)
(Optional) Task ID (costs of a particular task)
(Optional) Start searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format
(Optional) End searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format

(Optional) Time costs of particular type, possible values: **1|0**

_1_ - received from the timer
_0_ - entered manually

(Optional) Additional searching parameters (see description below)

Integer fields:

id=TASK_ID - returns costs of a particular task
project=PROJECT_ID - returns costs on tasks of a particular project

Equality and range operators for integer fields: =, in
Example: `project = 2456`, `id in (1234, 1240)`


String fields:

comment - user comment to a separate cost line (String)

Full or partial match for string fields: =, has
Example: `comment = 'Monthly report'`, `comment has 'report'`


Date fields:

dateadd - date, when the costs were added in the 'DD.MM. YYYY' format

Relational operators for date fields: >, <, >=, <=, ! =, =
Example: `dateadd = '01.05.2021'`


Query conditions can be combined with parentheses () and logical operations and, or (only in lowercase)
Example filter query: `&filter=(comment has 'report' or comment has 'review') and (dateadd<'25.05.2021' and dateadd>'31.05.2021')`

request.description: ###### Returns individual costs added for selected or all tasks

response.name: success

query.description: (Optional) Project ID (costs of all tasks of a particular project)
(Optional) Task ID (costs of a particular task)
(Optional) Start searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format
(Optional) End searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format

(Optional) Time costs of particular type, possible values: **1|0**

_1_ - received from the timer
_0_ - entered manually

(Optional) Additional searching parameters (see description below)

Integer fields:

id=TASK_ID - returns costs of a particular task
project=PROJECT_ID - returns costs on tasks of a particular project

Equality and range operators for integer fields: =, in
Example: `project = 2456`, `id in (1234, 1240)`


String fields:

comment - user comment to a separate cost line (String)

Full or partial match for string fields: =, has
Example: `comment = 'Monthly report'`, `comment has 'report'`


Date fields:

dateadd - date, when the costs were added in the 'DD.MM. YYYY' format

Relational operators for date fields: >, <, >=, <=, ! =, =
Example: `dateadd = '01.05.2021'`


Query conditions can be combined with parentheses () and logical operations and, or (only in lowercase)
Example filter query: `&filter=(comment has 'report' or comment has 'review') and (dateadd<'25.05.2021' and dateadd>'31.05.2021')`
(Optional) Project ID (costs of all tasks of a certain project)
(Optional) Task ID (costs of a certain task)
(Optional) Start searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format
(Optional) End searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format

(Optional) Time costs of particular type, possible values: **1|0**

_1_ - received from the timer
_0_ - entered manually

request.description: ###### Returns total costs added for selected or all tasks

query.description: (Optional) Project ID (costs of all tasks of a certain project)
(Optional) Task ID (costs of a certain task)
(Optional) Start searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format
(Optional) End searching date in DD.MM.YYYY format

(Optional) Time costs of particular type, possible values: **1|0**

_1_ - received from the timer
_0_ - entered manually

(Conditional) Time costs in one of the following formats: 0.15 / 0,15 / 0:09

At least one of parameters required: _time, money_
(Conditional) Financial costs in account currency (if it needs to be specified without reference to an hourly rate)
(Optional) Financial costs are calculated on an hourly rate (money parameter is ignored), possible value: **1**
(Optional) Cost author email (required if using admin token; will be set automatically if using access token)

item.name: Webhooks

request.description: ###### Returns webhooks list

query.description:
(Required) Events separated by commas, possible values: **post_task|post_comment|post_project|update_task|update_comment|update_project|delete_task|delete_comment|close_task**

Selected events will send notifications to Webhook URL

(Optional) Project IDs separated by commas

If you want to limit the sending of events only for particular projects

request.description: ###### Creates webhook

query.description: (Required) Events separated by commas, that will send notifications to the specified URL, possible values: **post_task,post_comment,post_project,update_task,update_comment,update_project,delete_task,delete_comment,close_task**
(Optional) Project IDs separated by commas (if you want to limit the sending of events only for particular projects)

(Required) Events separated by commas, that will send notifications to the specified URL, possible values: **post_task,post_comment,post_project,update_task,update_comment,update_project,delete_task,delete_comment,close_task**
(Optional) Project IDs separated by commas (if you want to limit the sending of events only for particular projects)

(Required) Webhook ID

Can be obtained through _get_webhooks_ method
